snippet: The Obama administration said that 16.4 million uninsured people had gained health coverage since major provisions of the Affordable Care Act began to take effect in 2010.
abstract: Health and Human Services Department reports 16.4 million uninsured people have gained health coverage since major provisions of the Affordable Care Act began to take effect in 2010, largest drop in number of uninsured in about 40 years; say proportion of American adults lacking insurance has fallen to 13.2 percent from 20.3 percent since first enrollment period started in October 2013.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration said that 16.4 million uninsured people had gained health coverage since major provisions of the Affordable Care Act began to take effect in 2010.

headline.main: Data on Health Law Shows Largest Drop in Uninsured in 4 Decades, the U.S. Says
headline.print_headline: Data on Health Law Shows Largest Drop in Uninsured in 4 Decades, the U.S. Says

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
